name: The Westin San Luis Potosi

reviews.text: I stayed with my wife at the Westin San Luis last weekend, and it was hell. They had a wedding party at the main patio/garden and the music was on until 2:30am, right 2:30 in the morning. The music felt so loud as if it was coming from inside my room. Next morning I tried to get the General Manager, he was not there but one of his assistants help to hear my complains. Couldn't be worst, she said they had warned me about the noise when I made my reservation using their website. Of course I never received such a warning.
reviews.title: Avoid it!
All the employees make you feel at home
reviews.text: The property is beautiful and Sunday brunch is great, but be careful if you want to spend a weekend there and they have a wedding celebration.

I was at the Westin SLP for a week and the employees make you feel at home, starting from the door man, the reception Ladies the room service, every employee works above average to serve you it was a great experience.
reviews.title: Hated it

reviews.text: I was born and raise in S.L.P. until the age of 19, now I live in Lyons IL and i travel a lot thru the USA. and the WESTIN SLP is the same as the WESTIN'S in USA or better.
reviews.title: Great value and beautiful
Oh my
reviews.text: The hotel is magnificent and I have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely

A group of us traveled to San Luis Potosi in February. After reading the reviews, we were a bit nervous about our stay. However, we were all very pleased with the property. The hotel itself is beautiful. The architecture and the furnishings are lovely. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. The buffet breakfast offered an excellent selection at a reasonable price. The room was cleaned very well - carpets vacummed every day, towels and water replaced daily, etc. I would recommend the property!
reviews.title: Better than I expected!

reviews.title: Incredible Hotel and Excellent Staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for two weeks on business. This was my first trip to Mexico so I was not sure exactly what to expect. But the Westin was certainly pleasant. The hotel/resort itself is gorgeous. Beautiful artwork, excellent deatail with an authentic Mexican feel. My room was very nice and quite comfortable. The bed was AMAZING. The most comfortable hotel bed I have ever been in. I think they call it the heavenly bed-it certainly deserves that name. I had a cute little balconly that you could stand out on. There was a small table near the balcony window which served perfect for solo room service meals. I LOVED the bathroom. Gorgeous marble flooor with a oversized marble bath. I took baths everynight because it was so relaxing. Even the artwork and detail in the bathroom was beautiful. My room very clean. the maids did an amazing job. My floor was vacuumed everday. Be aware that if you are in your room and you want privacy, put the lock on-the maids will come in at various times to leave candy, clean, or leave a note for free drinks at the bar (which is nice). I learned quickly that if I didnt want to be bothered then I needed to lock the door. The gym was very roomy and easily accessible. I ate at the restuarant almost every night. The food was very good and the service was excellent. The dining room itslef was gorgeous and if you came at the right time, there was someone playing the piano and/or singing- very relaxing. Wireless internet was not free :(. Huge drawback for me and I'm sure for all the other business travellers, but I was able to access intnet in the business lounge when no one was in there. The pool was beautiful and centrally located. In the afternoon the sun beats right down on it. But the "heated" pool was freezing. Keep in mind that this on of the nicest areas for weddings, parties, get togethers in the state. So be prepared for all of that on the weekends. I think that they're a few girls' birthday celebrations happending in the courtyards on Saturday which was nice, but that night there was a wedding reception---boy do Mexicans know how to party. It was beautiful, but loud-until about 3am. The hotel forwarned us and offered ear plugs that day-I thought it was a joke at first, but they were serious. It was loud, but it was the weekend so I wasn't mad about it. Overall the service was great--the staff will do anything for you and do it with a smile whether they understand you or not :). If you will be in SLP, you HAVE to stay here. You'd be a fool not to.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the Westin was tricky to find (make sure to have good directions before heading out), we were delighted with our stay at this hotel. From the complimentary fruity beverages at check-in...to the extensive (if not a bit pricey) breakfast buffet...we were pleased. Our rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable...providing down pillows and comforters and cable TV with several English language movie channels (subtitled of course).
reviews.title: We had a beautiful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas were also very nice. If you happen to be there before, during, or after a major group event (like a wedding), the courtyard, which IMO is the hotel's most impressive feature, may be cluttered with canopies or canopy framing. I was unable to take the picture I wanted to because of this framing but finally got a partial shot of the courtyard while the staff was bringing the framing down the next morning.
reviews.title: A Nice Place to stay

reviews.text: During our time there we visited their restaurant for dinner (food was good, but service was lax), and for their breakfast buffet (with options of a continental style breakfast with fruits, breads, homemade jams and cereals or a more thorough warm meal that included eggs served several ways, chilaquiles, meats, and omelets and tortas made to order).
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit removed from the city's historic center (and even the closest major road), but if you've got good directions and are comfortable driving in Mexico, this shouldn't be too much of a concern.
reviews.title: Love the Beds!
Magical Place
reviews.text: I have stayed on numerous occasions at the Westin SLP since 1997. This is always with great pleasure that I stay there in this magnificent reconstruction of colonial Mexico.

Look at the details of the architecture, all these stones (local pink "cantera")which were all hand carved. This hotel used to be part of the Quinta Real family, a small Mexican chain that runs 7 or 8 beautiful buildings from Monterrey to Huatulco.
reviews.title: Not a business hotel

reviews.text: I always feel like I am changing planet every time I walk into the Westin. It has a lot of magic transporting you back into the 18th and 19th century.
reviews.title: Interesting architecture
Great place to spend the night
reviews.text: There are 2 key dates that make the place even more special: the September 16th celebration and the New Year festivities. Special events take place there and they are worth being part of them.
